titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1977) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1996, and for other purposes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 71.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-184, by Ms. Pryce.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1977 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with section 302(f), 306, or308(a) of the Budget Act shall be waived. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. The amendments printed in section 2 of this resolution shall be considered as adopted in the House and in the Committee of the Whole. All points of order against the amendment printed in section 3 of this resolution shall be waived. During consideration of the bill for amendment, priority in recognition shall be given to those Members who have had their amendments printed in the Congressional Record. No points of order against the amendments for failure to comply with clause 2(e) of rule XXI shall be waived.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 194 (Roll no. 498).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 229 - 195 (Roll no. 499).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/13/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the open rule for the consideration of H.R. 1977 (Department of the Interior and related agencies appropriations).
